topic.title: Interrupts

body.p: Device hardware provides interrupt aggregation of device interrupt sources towards the embedded processor, the device interrupt output pin, and for generation of PCIe INTx, MSI, or MSIx notifications.

The SDK software and firmware together provide a mechanism to retrieve interrupt and status data for the entire device to the user. The SDK provides an interface for retrieving, enabling, disabling, and clearing interrupts.
The interrupts and status are presented to the user in structures that are defined per channel. The interrupt and status data is stored in host shared memory, similar to PMON operation.
The implementation is OS independent and a porting interface is available to propagate hardware interrupts to the SDK interrupt module on the host.
The various modes of operation that the user can use are:

li.p: Polling mode: user-triggered poll will trigger check for active interrupts.
Interrupt mode: hardware interrupt will trigger check for active interrupts.
Hybrid polling/interrupt mode: use hardware interrupts to trigger high priority actions, while using polling to process low priority interrupts.
